v.en: join, link, attach or tie together by their extremities
glaze with a thin layer of apricot preserve
tie the horses one behind the other
kiss (old-fashioned); to outdo, to be had; to have sex (vulgar slang)
bandage; to have a hard-on (vulgar slang)
trumpet (make the cry of an elephant); to moan, groan
spoil, to take great care of someone/something
mock, make fun of completely a thing or person
disband, to get soft, opposite of bander
reduce slowly to the consistency of puree
examine livestock to see if it is healthy or measly
watch, to check out, lit. to look at
dump someone, lit. to plate / to drop / send to the door
work a field, vineyard for the fourth time (agriculture)
divide into fourths, to get an A-K-Q-J (cards)
put writing, in good order, in a style clear and appropriate
rejudge - to judge again; to reexamine
ultrafiltrate (UF) - a variety of membrane filtration
transport by car (expecially when speaking of food, goods)
install voliges (thin boards, on which lay roofing tiles)
volley (to strike, a tennis ball for example, before it touches the ground)
move to avoid the blows of the enemy (fencing); to twist, roll
to address as vous (regionalism, variant of vouvoyer)
